elements.2211.03240_a069a93e939457efebec334fba3af: A fundamental question in any peer-to-peer ride-sharing system is how to, both effectively and efficiently, meet the request of passengers to balance the supply and demand in real time
elements.2211.03240_c17eb6c9d583ad85e640c38fe3ecf: On the passenger side, traditional approaches focus on pricing strategies by increasing the probability of users' call to adjust the distribution of demand
elements.2211.03240_d66fe36ccf8c9240ae6dec4477d8a: However, previous methods do not take into account the impact of changes in strategy on future supply and demand changes, which means drivers are repositioned to different destinations due to passengers' calls, which will affect the driver's income for a period of time in the future
elements.2211.03240_533c20879417be28fef1fdaf003a7: Motivated by this observation, we make an attempt to optimize the distribution of demand to handle this problem by learning the long-term spatio-temporal values as a guideline for pricing strategy
elements.2211.03240_ae84265dbb0c575afafa0f9913b11: In this study, we propose an offline deep reinforcement learning based method focusing on the demand side to improve the utilization of transportation resources and customer satisfaction
elements.2211.03240_cb6e1bc789825db0f2117d1555e73: We adopt a spatio-temporal learning method to learn the value of different time and location, then incentivize the ride requests of passengers to adjust the distribution of demand to balance the supply and demand in the system
elements.2211.03240_838c968cd5f6acf7f10af6c403384: In particular, we model the problem as a Markov Decision Process (MDP)
elements.2211.03240_992e59ac7001cf44c2436c6aebb2c: The problem is solved in two steps: 1) based on historical trip data from the ride-hailing platform, we propose a deep reinforcement learning based method with constrained actions to summarize demand and supply patterns into a Spatio-Temporal network, 2) to solve the budget constraint problem in the spatio-temporal incentive, we formulate an integer programming step in real-time policy learning process, where each state-action pair is valued in terms of immediate reward, future gains and discount budget
elements.2211.03240_f905266c6a5a23ac9888bcabc2311: Through experiments, we demonstrate that our proposed approach can deliver improvement on the marketplace efficiency.
elements.2211.03240_7a850468ecc53c544010a08dca7ad: With rapid development of the Global Position System(GPS), and on-demand ride-hailing services such as Uber, Lyft and Didi Chuxing, significant improvements has been achieved over traditional taxi systems
elements.2211.03240_bc03261f2b8b2cbc63f8724018694: Massive amount of trip data become available, offering much more opportunities for providing more intelligent and convenient services and a surge in passion in research fields such as driving routing planning
elements.2211.03240_7dfdf7ff554fb9a4d091dd87b6f20: One of the most important task in online ride-hailing platforms is to balance supply and demand situation in advance.
elements.2211.03240_21318d403b21fd290c9be5f71e8ad: Once passenger's request has been answered, the trip would bring both the passenger and the driver to the destination, which can be viewed as a process of relocating the driver to the destination
elements.2211.03240_5c0ebce2d0a99a9864f3e60fb2be9: The driver can answer future requests at the new location
elements.2211.03240_d7c504dd92a32eec926ed63d65f6c: For example, when a ride order travels to a hot (high demand) zone where drivers are more needed, after fulfilling the ride, the driver is more likely to receive new requests there
elements.2211.03240_14d7904541e49dc5f7a36efa34442: If the situation of traversing to a hotter zone persists, the driver can receive more gain in the long turn
elements.2211.03240_687af8723b38a7e76878b11b6da2a: Hence, we see that the value of a trip goes beyond the trip fare and depends also on the spatio-temporal long-term values.
elements.2211.03240_e4c1a51a128f03e4fa840b97463f7: Dynamic pricing and incentives are one of the levers in the ride-hailing system that can influence both supply and demand distributions to make them more aligned, and hence, improving customer experience through higher driver income and request answer rate.
elements.2211.03240_c372dca84699e5338ace4d38307f0: Dynamic pricing and spatial pricing are mainly explored by previous researchers
elements.2211.03240_7d8ed941bff16d641234fc821602c: Some work focused on approximate dynamic programming(ADP)
elements.2211.03240_90e329cde0964ebea37881a28207b: Other researchers build up spatial equilibrium
elements.2211.03240_b8441086d272b4245eb9a95339acb: These research studies have some limitations
elements.2211.03240_da967fa47d8087a85b562dd756373: For example, they can examine dynamic and spatial pricing separately but not simultaneously
elements.2211.03240_3b4256d06e5bc898ecf48d25d8160: Recently, to achieve spatio-temporal incentivization, some work of reinforcement learning enhanced agent-based modeling and simulation system have been explored
elements.2211.03240_c36461edbee15cd3cce412e995166: However, to optimize the reinforcement learning policy, the method requires to build up a data-driven simulation environment to mimic a real-world ride-sourcing platform's operations on a city network to enable online training
elements.2211.03240_66d2b64f74fc58c709696ac72c300: has drawn a lot of attention since it promises to learn effective policies from previously-collected, static datasets without further interaction
elements.2211.03240_54e298ba0822b3ce91e4c0707abf0: Because offline RL does not rely on the built environment, it has achieved great success in many real-world application scenarios, such as recommendation system, real-time decision-making system, advertising optimization, robotics and so on
elements.2211.03240_e77aa7330bf5395b5cd29442412d0: proposed a batch-constrained reinforcement learning method close to on-policy with respect to the available data to solve the extrapolation error problem
elements.2211.03240_15e08cca0a20df2671291e8da4425: is a practical solution to reduce the bootstrapping error accumulation
elements.2211.03240_a0330ca7ad668a6b13735605d6658: However, our problem can not be solved directly with the existing offline RL method
elements.2211.03240_5ad5379af998da3b3a8e2f21899d9: In the real ride-hailing scenarios, when we model the spatio-temporal incentives optimization problem as a Markov Decision Process(MDP), incentive is treated as the action and it will bring the related cost when optimizing the policy
elements.2211.03240_e307f6e9fb85dec4695ac9a3503bb: to study the MDP problem under budget constraints while none of them will work in the offline RL scenarios
elements.2211.03240_53ac2b0fbe8aff8695329eedfef77: It brings more challenges when we constrain the budget of the whole city from a global view, the solution space of this problem will be huge and it becomes a NP-hard problem
elements.2211.03240_6d946e61033a4ee729c14a1f23868: Our work adopts reinforcement learning methods, but instead of training a simulated ride-sourcing platform and an on-policy agent, we formulate our problem in the offline reinforcement learning setting, and utilize previously collected data, without additional online interactions with the environment
elements.2211.03240_c507e7d52c975a28b898c04c344f3: The goal for spatio-temporal incentive is not only to fulfill the ride requests of the current passengers, but also to optimize the anticipated future gains
elements.2211.03240_ec1ace384fd9569b3a3d305c2ac5f: In this study, we propose an offline deep reinforcement learning to learn the spatio-temporal value network to model the demand and mobility patterns for the whole city
elements.2211.03240_9361ab889da483c5098c9f327b412: In addition, to solve the budget constraint problem during the policy learning, we formulate it as an integer programming process to conduct the policy optimization within the limitation of budget threshold and learn the state-action network simultaneously
elements.2211.03240_6b8786ca0375f6b2192b7c3520b44: To verify the effectiveness of the proposed method, we apply it to a real ride-hailing system
elements.2211.03240_27f502f2611c444a0790177c8eb69: Through comparative evaluations, our proposed method shows significant improvements in the real-world application.
elements.2211.03240_12cc737f73517999cd8d70f4d042c: The contribution of this work can be summarized as follows:
elements.2211.03240_6a22c7e878969127495e71270d0d7: We propose a novel offline reinforcement learning to dynamically adjust the spatial-temporal distribution of demand to balance driver supply and customer demands
elements.2211.03240_ed9c4e691f87b9f4c23b32828475f: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first work of offline RL to optimize spatio-temporal problem on the demand side.
elements.2211.03240_94c041c52ae5e1c1b2ceea92c5e49: We tackle the budget constraint problem in the offline RL setting by formulating the constraint RL problem as an integer programming process to learn the spatio-temporal value network as well as control the resource consumption of policy.
elements.2211.03240_1f697bc250e7b65378d7f92f576e0: Experiments are conducted under different times of the week(weekdays, weekends) and from multiple aspects to analyze supply and demand, including comparing to SOTA offline RL algorithms
elements.2211.03240_b4e5e9395e8e521caac48b735d770: We largely improve both revenue and efficiency in balancing supply and demand across the city.
elements.2211.03240_244d13a3fe801ff946c9728415c20: In what follows, we will describe the passenger pricing problem in section
elements.2211.03240_06d8acb8b19f955e7004235c38624: and formulate our MDP in section
elements.2211.03240_77a981e82249c54eb9a98f6bd4d7c: The detailed explanation of our deep Q-network approach combined with Integer Programming can be found in section
elements.2211.03240_f56fc3b404aa958bf1e4d43157f43: The learning and optimization capabilities of our deep reinforcement learning algorithm and the advantage of the integer programming method through a set of experiments in section
elements.2211.03240_5ba6e23e63341d4c065ccb64291d9: using real data from a major ride-hailing platform
elements.2211.03240_f1f7917108cee1367cc650ef9034f: We close the paper with a few concluding remarks in section
elements.2211.03240_5819cede8410cc333fdea75e744fd: Background and System Overview of Spatio-temporal Incentive
elements.2211.03240_fcb3d6364aef526de9e6030d809d8: Recently, on-demand online ride-hailing platform like Uber, Lyft, and DiDi provide a more efficient way of transportation
elements.2211.03240_6fa9ff081fdd7e2ea45eac91df977: On the passengers' side, before they actually request a ride order, they need to provide information of the ride, including the starting location, destination and the time of the ride order
elements.2211.03240_cbc25472596ce7159edc8f6263eee: We name this stage as ride inquiry
elements.2211.03240_f13b12325c3b79f42c026294cf41c: Then, these online ride services have a centralized system to give some information back to the passengers, such as estimated travel time and estimated ride fee
elements.2211.03240_6a7c632214ae2faaa3b76ae48e9ff: Finally, based on these information, passengers can decide whether they actually want to place the ride order
elements.2211.03240_9c9e627ce774aa418d6ce1f80c1c9: We name this stage as ride request
elements.2211.03240_d41e8ad9a202309bd67aa191ee522: The conversion probability from ride inquiry to ride request is defined as estimated-call-rate (ECR)
elements.2211.03240_6eed621eb1f5a365d5aac2804ab8b: Naturally, while other information of the ride keeps unchanged, the cheaper the fee is, the higher the ecr would be
elements.2211.03240_3a42c55a6466b3eaa362e357a892e: Once the passenger requests for a ride, the central dispatching system will try to match a driver to pick up the passenger to finish the ride
elements.2211.03240_f86d5754c525f2b247b8e35f01d10: The probability of a ride being successfully completed by a driver is called completion-rate(CR)
elements.2211.03240_fb5d1a6a55c59910fe01748de5dcf: CR will not be affected by ride pricing
elements.2211.03240_8a83c129e3dd636d52d7db95112b9: The optimization of passenger pricing and incentive is crucial to balance the demand and supply since the incentive strategy will directly have influences on the distribution of demand
elements.2211.03240_e95d21b5c356f964801cf5c820beb: One special case is that when the amount of supply is much larger than the demand, which means there are more idle drivers in this region, the platform should give more discount to passengers to increase the demand amount, helping drivers complete more orders and increase drivers' income
elements.2211.03240_a9fa98ffba9c44c1619042b130a25: Another case is that when amount of supply is less than the demand, which means there are a lot of trip request in this region
elements.2211.03240_a574b77c059ef77585edb4f45f970: However, different order requests have different destinations, which will take the driver to a different geographic location in the next moment and affect the driverâs future income
elements.2211.03240_a30bdb92c7c53d00c16b7b6c4f430: If the driver goes from the hot zone to the cold zone, it will reduce the driverâs income from the next order, otherwise it will increase the driverâs probability of taking orders and increase income
elements.2211.03240_af75fe1c9526db22ffb187e7cc8c5: Therefore, the optimization of the pricing strategy is crucial to the driver's income, the balance of supply and demand, and the improvement of the overall trading market efficiency
elements.2211.03240_80a86c34970811575df116ccd1e59: The incentives system is responsible for distributing real-time discounts to passengers with open trip inquiries
elements.2211.03240_a66c646be743acb827b54a4086a83: shows a system overview of how it works in practice.
elements.2211.03240_de5855803f1e22e7e37af02d3b313: Every time a passenger enters the ride inquiry stage, a centralized decision system would decide on the discount rate of the current ride
elements.2211.03240_0d30a5b96f498bd1ebea9539bef27: Initially, the decision only affects passenger's ecr of the order
elements.2211.03240_4bea06ffbff31fa22b497e0967143: Once the passenger enters the ride request stage and is successfully picked up by a driver, the discount would only takes effect at the payment stage
elements.2211.03240_b79492b26018601e48fe5ff22c8f6: Given both historical ride data and real-time order information, we can potentially optimize the pricing systemâs global efficiency in a long horizon by spatio-temporal pricing
elements.2211.03240_b17939b1c58e0ca7682b315676508: When a passenger requests a ride and the order is finished, he or she has moved from the starting location to the destination
elements.2211.03240_0d6de2b0f3b95e75b6d25f091098b: Meanwhile, the driver who carries out the ride, is also relocated to the destination
elements.2211.03240_f1efbd7f124f3b7f97c8419bb4d62: Hence, a trip changes the spatio-temporal state of a driver, which together with demand distributions, forms the basis for future order matching and vehicle repositions
elements.2211.03240_8d74ae0c864363a5f88aa2c9e9296: The spatio-temporal state values are the quantities that characterize these long-term effects and can thus guide the incentives decisions to optimize global metrics, e.g., total driver income.
elements.2211.03240_b5f183502297f14e157f5d8e685cc: The learning step aims to provide a quantitative measure of the spatio-temporal patterns of the ride supply and passenger demand across the whole city
elements.2211.03240_3ef1f54d6f20c660ff4a582d81e08: Given historical off-line ride data, we build a Markov Decision Process (MDP) representing rides happening on the platform
elements.2211.03240_c814330ad1d207b4f97b185aea24b: The learned value functions provide quantitative values for each spatio-temporal state, which is later used in the discount planning step.
elements.2211.03240_c96c79b445d365e3276dcabba7a89: The MDP we build here is in a global view
elements.2211.03240_1a02b47091e58a5776256f372c432: , it proposed a tabular based reinforcement learning method to solve the problem of order dispatch in the ride-hailing platform from the perspective of local view, which aims to match drivers with different ride orders, each driver is modeled as an agent
elements.2211.03240_8aaef2505049d9afcc34ac97a69e4: However, in this study, unlike drivers, if a passenger requests a ride from location A to location B, there's no guarantee that he or she will request the next ride starting from location B. Hence, we can not model each independent passenger as an agent
elements.2211.03240_4f2290b52fb4ac222b61127a547e4: Instead, we adopt the global-view setting which we do not distinguish individual passengers
elements.2211.03240_5f620a019d26ddf7cf8b3d1f2c70b: Each passenger is regarded as the same
elements.2211.03240_d3d49e0bf76f1f1eaf67c70705119: For example, if one ride transits from A at time t and arrives at B at time t+1, any ride leaving B at time t+1 can be regarded as our possible next transit
elements.2211.03240_e7276ec33021c93c44085bd02d2db: When a passenger requests a ride, we have the information of the starting location, destination, time of the request, estimated travel time and estimated ride cost
elements.2211.03240_cceb1511be56c566ff81d7940c662: Our MDP formulation uses these available information
elements.2211.03240_c93b13d134a60532bcd36fcef324f: A trip transition consists of order request, pick-up and completion: The passenger enters the origin and destination location
elements.2211.03240_5f2f30432e1f17179209e568f38aa: Ride-hailing platforms provide estimated travel time and fee
elements.2211.03240_1744f66312e986634857a4b6671b3: The trip moves the driver and passenger to the destination
elements.2211.03240_bf4aaa26eb82501593e3f7add420d: The driver earns an immediate reward (trip fee) from this transition
elements.2211.03240_f94afe641995596310821df63fdbd: We list the key elements of our MDP formulation below.
elements.2211.03240_59615daf48c96d300a4178dfe3dd3: The state is defined to indicate geo-location information of the starting location and the time of the ride request
elements.2211.03240_2c8bae6ae89677a6bbadd05b345cf: For simplicity, we quantize time periods into semi-hours
elements.2211.03240_caa6a21f36dfb3da99a8199480819: represents the grid region where the trip starts,
elements.2211.03240_aec6332ac0faee0bdd90efbd0aeb3: We also differentiate the time for weekday and weekend
elements.2211.03240_3118bac44975b58438d2376fdd53d: contains the additional contextual features, such as the statistics of supply and demand of the current grid
elements.2211.03240_eba5f9f97d3b22c6efaee53f90dda: The action is defined as the discount assigned to the trip
elements.2211.03240_635703b8cc64dadafa0c990735576: Action space is discrete: 0.75, 0.8, 0.85, 0.9, 0.95, 1, corresponding to 25
elements.2211.03240_cdca562f95b1d243fc329ede3f6ea: off and no discount of the ride fee
elements.2211.03240_0da1f5898b8378df60d18e4c3f420: Naturally, as the discount goes up of the ride fee, the probability of a ride inquiry becoming a actual ride request would increase.
elements.2211.03240_73a777caf8080030911f66b321e32: In order dispatch setting, reward is defined as the total fee collected for the trip
elements.2211.03240_577b6d99abd9f64ebe78381dd02d9: Intuitively, in our problem, the reward can be defined as:
elements.2211.03240_708881de9e747d60b45d3c8036afa: represents the trip fare of trip
elements.2211.03240_730f18868270608bcf30c2782f648: The optimal value network of a state s,
elements.2211.03240_b98e79be40524bd4f74e2278dfa70: , would be the optimal estimated future delta Gross Merchandise Volume(GMV).
elements.2211.03240_8743b4349f780f167a3e389559841: An episode is one complete day, from 0:00 am to 23:59pm
elements.2211.03240_417a177923e3e167be4f436b6bb08: Trips crosses midnight are regarded as terminal state.
elements.2211.03240_d93419995a4903448d9e38ec35e39: The discount distribution have to be made in a rolling horizon manner
elements.2211.03240_cffb17c347a2e73ad50c7d2d594a5: In real work application, at the time of a ride request, the actual trip fare and travel time are unknown
elements.2211.03240_a3dfebb6dcd79be5ba9ca9227d823: Our system have to depends on the estimated arrival time and estimated price to make decisions
elements.2211.03240_b3080f20e097d92baaaad01a97c73: The error distribution of these estimations are implicitly captured by state transitions and reward distributions.
elements.2211.03240_b38ad67ca2f2e4176eeb40eacb04a: The discount factor in the MDP definition controls how far we look in to the future
elements.2211.03240_796ea3e218ce1d535d2e925650f7f: In the order dispatch problem, the rewards defined in
elements.2211.03240_edcc31ff45af5eeefc2b1386f7ccc: Here in our passenger discount application, we adopt the same discounting methods

elements.2211.03240_6969543b3392aa6cee791ea46f632: In this section, we proposed an offline deep reinforcement learning method to learn the long-term spatio-temporal value for the whole city, to dynamically change the distribution of demand and achieve a state of balance between supply and demand, improving the efficiency of the marketplace
elements.2211.03240_0bb886263452121dce48cfecc3f12: For more detailed information of our proposed method, please refer to the pseudocode provided in Algorithm
elements.2211.03240_95ae35937b2880caa4b908cf5a3e3: and the architecture overview in figure
elements.2211.03240_bee0b450f5d3132e2ca918ee72156: To solve the MDP formulation, we adopt the model-free approach and use the deep reinforcement learning framework proposed in
elements.2211.03240_83a40cffbb1bb34bc521ede217b54: In the deep Q-network framework, the mini-batch update is a step for solving a bootstrapped regression model with the Mean Squared Error loss function:

elements.2211.03240_4a5c53efd1d3864d644152cbb85b4: ) is modified so that the argmax is evaluated by Q network, and the highest valued action is used by the target Q network as follows:
elements.2211.03240_3269dbfbfb9b7e7c12126a9a387f5: Building a realistic simulator to imitate city-scale driver and passenger dynamics is very challenging
elements.2211.03240_1543bf984bb8e9be36862f7adfafb: However, a large number of historical trips are usually available
elements.2211.03240_230583a5f7f50cbb50c22ff143542: Hence, we use historical trip data for training, which means our training is off-line and we do not interact with any environment during training
elements.2211.03240_666aa604ec650a6ffa88a3fe476ac: The historical data is generated by some existing behavior policy
elements.2211.03240_ae8673336a9d3e1c79470e38f731b: These data are retrieved from data warehouse and store in a replay buffer for training similar to
elements.2211.03240_562a73857fe6a72c22e97889faaf7: During training, each mini-batch is sampled from the replay buffer to train the Q and V spatio-temporal network.
elements.2211.03240_4950355adfbf635d0a9205bebdefc: Having a good state representation is usually the key step to solving a practical problem with neural networks
elements.2211.03240_fb5ba146920bad25e9b813f264e9e: In our spatio-temporal incentives optimization problem, we require the parse of complicated state information as the basis for long term reasoning
elements.2211.03240_e8a3a4d517e52c52b7f2b57e322ab: Hence, we adopt the cerebellar embedding scheme used in order dispatching problem
elements.2211.03240_243539787870afeef8d87bfac1acc: Cerebellar embedding combines CMACs with embedding to obtain a distributed state representation
elements.2211.03240_4bacf28d5133ccef2488783077b26: that is generalizable, extensible and robust
elements.2211.03240_970e17064e22008e91992b9f2ee3b: CMACs involves multiple overlapping tilings of the state space
elements.2211.03240_dff2733c861a93a009c4ab59c1b1e: The total number of tiles is the size of the conceptual memory
elements.2211.03240_d3d6cbe71e2813f945c837d190975: The mapping from input to tiles is done such that input points close together in the input space have considerable overlap between their set of activated tiles
elements.2211.03240_b94a666342168bfbe0847f336ba36: The output of CMACs is computed as the sum of the weights of the activated tiles.
elements.2211.03240_2f01dd4c2a1de493dd853ecf6c341: Load historical data into the replay buffer
elements.2211.03240_83f6601f66c3574d09418792d836e: by one step of gradient descent on
elements.2211.03240_4ec60abe211c49de4941d94325625: An randomly initialized embedding matrix is used as the actual memory and the mapping is implemented using a sparse representation
elements.2211.03240_ca82f36abec8e28ea381b11e8deb2: It defines multiple tiling functions and each function would map the continuous input to a unique string id indicating one discretized region of the state space
elements.2211.03240_8caa7789827f67e02934378318c52: The full details of cerebellar embedding can be found in
elements.2211.03240_1e94fc99e9b3856eb850f2c48f891: To quantize the geographical space, we also adopt the hierarchical coarse-coding in the location space as in
elements.2211.03240_2f027e29b4b82dc5677d2f3f9e6aa: Hexagon is used as the tile shape because hexagons have only one distance between a hexagon center-point and its neighbors.
elements.2211.03240_f6a592610a6da405789b2b36fc0b7: Off-line reinforcement learning has the problem of extrapolation error
elements.2211.03240_eecd559d421ff942561c576b67a3a: Exploration error happens due to mismatch in the distribution of data produced by the policy and the distribution of data contained in the batch.
elements.2211.03240_3b36a54caea72c47d7e9d26f52669: introduce batch-constrained reinforcement learning, where agents are trained to maximize accumulated rewards and minimize the distance of selected actions to the data in the batch
elements.2211.03240_260a1d0190a8ff9de96b0725c4722: Recall that our action space is discrete
elements.2211.03240_7ee53c3d2f7821ce130ce65c151d4: Hence, to tackle extrapolation error, we perform a simple action search combined with Q networks, so that selected highest valued action has been seen in the batch.
elements.2211.03240_ac755c9b997b340df5211d76731cb: is the discretized spatio-temporal grid that state s falls into and
elements.2211.03240_053030e6be5124d72102d2bb634f7: If the action search returns an empty action set, we would randomly select an action instead of the highest valued action to ensure exploration.
elements.2211.03240_ab119888a95cb7d542a6b811e5cb6: Naturally, we would define the trips across the day as our terminal states
elements.2211.03240_a70eda8560f39eed6b7a073c1a87a: However, in reality, especially in big cities, there are still a large amount of trips happening around midnight
elements.2211.03240_e459a51641f3c0157c51c6a1f59e6: Hence, in order to be consistent with real world situations, we define trips crossing 3:00am as our terminal states.
elements.2211.03240_85c98673c61208ad091ae4e9459ad: Recall that our action space is discrete, given the deep Q-network framework, a natural policy is to select actions that maximize the learned Q values
elements.2211.03240_119d66f2c166162abec15b4e1a267: However, in this specific application environment, ride-hailing platforms have a total budget for distributing discounts to passengers
elements.2211.03240_9d7000c3dfe01c7c2795e87b9cc71: Hence, we need to make sure that discount distribution induced by our policy will not exceed the total budget
elements.2211.03240_0f118c414dd07b2cf7618eb1865a7: Simply selecting the highest valued action does not guarantee this constrain
elements.2211.03240_15434f90e1104fae75379ca0bc04c: Instead, we form the optimal discount distribution problem as an Integer Programming problem:
elements.2211.03240_8ba03f4897a39fabb12cd3a08e0b0: represents the value matrix of the trips we want to solve,
elements.2211.03240_741b0e9dea078146786507c1d5b90: represents the corresponding cost for discounts,
elements.2211.03240_1ea57938cfdd34132f073b42cf383: is a binary matrix such that for each trip, only one of the 6 actions has the corresponding value of 1
elements.2211.03240_e2c76668526226d592c4b958db678: as a N by 6 matrix to represent the different values each trip can get under different actions
elements.2211.03240_40b75cca7dfeb87dbf99fd7312853: N represents the number of trips.
elements.2211.03240_bbd5e46db05e27f4c4892499a58aa: is a hyper-parameter used to weigh between the trip fare and the Spatio-Temporal value transitions traveling from the starting location to the destination. cr
elements.2211.03240_d9da123bbf52d4a7966c343770f05: indicates the probability of successful completion of the order.
elements.2211.03240_2305391b9c9203f8ca80ded2f5ab4: represents the discrete actions which take values of 0.75, 0.8, 0.85, 0.9, 0.95 and 1
elements.2211.03240_9a140db224d1f3f37b0eb0aa857d6: By solving the integer programming problem, we receive a discount distribution that optimize for the combination of trip fares and Spatio-Temporal value transitions, meanwhile, we do not exceed budget.
elements.2211.03240_b48e2595d26bd55bb5f0ab531fe26: In this section, we will discuss the experiment settings and results
elements.2211.03240_5947500f0f45466cd8ebee3a6889b: We use historical ExpressCar trip data obtained from a major ride-hailing platform as our training data
elements.2211.03240_191746ce9a4c48c2b74120c1fc8d6: The data set consists of over three millions of trips happening from April 13th to April 26th, 2020 and is divided into training set (one week) and testing set (one week)
elements.2211.03240_65aa73445c35ac3122108d30c16be: Data points in each mini-batch are viewed as samples on the Q value function
elements.2211.03240_f8d637d4366d13ff4c6ab700aa4dd: and normalized all state vectors with their population mean and standard deviation
elements.2211.03240_efd3afddb60f3164d32d79b192f8a: We found the pre-processing was necessary for a stable training
elements.2211.03240_4e82e33d218dea058797540907a3c: To provide a more complete and direct understanding of the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm, we evaluate it from three different aspects, including a environment simulation, algorithm performance comparison and map visualization.
elements.2211.03240_229191eef068fcc9ea70152dbc43e: In reality, whether a passenger go from ride inquiry stage to actual ride request is either yes or no, however, boolean variable is not convenient for us to model the changes in the customers' call-rate
elements.2211.03240_025cfea2ee8eec9dac372f6fd1c01: Hence, based on historical data, we build a model to simulate the transitions and turn the boolean variable into ECR values
elements.2211.03240_94b150ea73a5457a47e1ed4f0681d: ECR ranges from 0 to 1 exclusive of boundaries
elements.2211.03240_cfde2446c0d224ea799daa1292f9c: Before using estimated probability in our DRL algorithm training, we first evaluate the performance compared to historical data
elements.2211.03240_fe106f8b813db0d2eea569afc8a07: , for rides happening in each 30-minutes interval in a consecutive 14 days, we sum up the ride fares
elements.2211.03240_e543d1a33a6981dafa492b39f2a04: The x axis represents each semi-hour and ranges from 1 to 48
elements.2211.03240_30b5b87bbea1af0f0f927baa22155: The y axis is the sum of all the fares during the 14 days, we name it as Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV)
elements.2211.03240_e7c068ff654253ba838929927b08e: In real world situation, the expected revenue contribution of each trip inquiry equals its ride fee times the ecr
elements.2211.03240_b8647e51719c6b97efc35c6ef4251: label, which is the boolean variable of whether a passenger turns from ride inquiry to ride request, and then times the applied discount
elements.2211.03240_9d3134a171f5c59d87b6863b17757: The results are plotted in orange and labeled as real
elements.2211.03240_5c10760a757f02b650fda6557dff5: Meanwhile, for the same number of rides, we sum up the total simulation fare
elements.2211.03240_5a5444522a79cb1835d27cc06a262: The simulation fare of each trip is calculated as the product of the ride fee, ecr, and the applied discount of each trip
elements.2211.03240_a3dcd33b3950b9f8f0459ffab7dd1: Ecr is our modeled probability of the passenger turning from ride inquiry to ride request under the applied discount of each trip
elements.2211.03240_153a6ed42694551b53ad6eca99660: The results are plotted in blue and labeled as simulation
elements.2211.03240_4894d588a3cedea0b46f5e17509d2: We can find that the simulated GMV trend is basically consistent with the real historical GMV trend
elements.2211.03240_3119e8dcc17df26fb110298dfcba7: There will be slight differences in some periods, but the overall simulation error is still relatively low
elements.2211.03240_b5dea3eb0ba49353e2959907bbe05: In real world application, when a passenger decide not to request a ride order after inquiring the price, the gain of the trip is zero
elements.2211.03240_8787669b39093b9fd61add36ac2e6: The same trip in our simulation, would have a gain larger than zero, because the model probability is always larger than zero
elements.2211.03240_9996548f744e4c74af257b292c5ed: Reversely, if a passenger decide to place a request, the ecr
elements.2211.03240_4ab35e8a14c6187383b3b47cded52: In this case, the product equals the ride fee times the applied discount
elements.2211.03240_340f530e6f11eaafc5759337262cd: Under the same situation, since our modeled probability, ecr, is less than one, the fare in simulation is smaller than the fare in reality
elements.2211.03240_c687297bf191c6d415a18ee80fe61: Ideally, when we have a very large numbers of trips, the sum of their total fares would be very close under two different modes by Law of Large Numbers
elements.2211.03240_100679b57a9071b9c43be628aa4b9: , we can discover that, during the 48 semi hours, our ecr model has a close performance compared to historical real data
elements.2211.03240_db5dc9f4f2d7dc53726c146e8e66d: Our simulation values are slightly lower after 9:00am, but the differences are within a reasonable range.
elements.2211.03240_2d3db0f6da7cf5796cabfb3af9041: In addition to ecr, we also do the same simulation on complete-rate (cr) to model the actual cr
elements.2211.03240_4e7bddd518d07727d5b144f2697cd: which is the boolean variable indicating whether a driver has successfully answered the call and finished the ride
elements.2211.03240_b823c9afac1c4e9228946b609e566: Similar to ecr model, in Figure
elements.2211.03240_4a32b952549d692b9f0de63e61c23: , our simulation values are bit lower than the real data
elements.2211.03240_f1d5a6a096ff4ac99a308bd4048f6: But the differences are acceptable when averaged over millions of rides over two weeks.
elements.2211.03240_3a06403f1922d9d7ca86cb2235a07: We use one week of historical trip data in one city obtained from
elements.2211.03240_5b61e30becf4b5fba5a9ba7a04bde: a major ride-hailing platform dispatching platform as our training data for learning the Spatio-Temporal network
elements.2211.03240_5f8033f5875cce940afac081c666b: We build the Spatio-Temporal network with two hidden dense layers and ReLU activation functions
elements.2211.03240_8cd12d9a9464ae39d89c20b75a45c: is then used to solve an IP policy
elements.2211.03240_0bcffa40a41b55c5c923acc820061: When solving the policy, we use
elements.2211.03240_ce23c7fc8a44229e794ef3aba2f0a: To evaluate our policy, we solve the IP policy on a week of historical unseen trip data and compare discounts assigned by our policy, with historical discounts, where historical discounts are taken according to the pricing strategy used at that time
elements.2211.03240_26cc9ba687dd980f0cb8f5cda8a48: Because our problem is under the batch DRL setting, which is purely off-line with no interactions with the environment, we pick two off-line DRL algorithms BCQ
elements.2211.03240_614c7c627904877ff43ec7045f0ac: Since BCQ and BEAR do not include an Integer Programming stage to limit the budget for discounting, if we use the same reward definition as mentioned in equation
elements.2211.03240_ff7c67619672435c2ee76aaf837d4: , we would result in a policy assigning largest discounts to all trips
elements.2211.03240_c0567e4ab665938f9c5aa5c90725a: Hence, when training BCQ and BEAR algorithms, we add a penalty term to each reward to indicate how much we need to compensate for distributing the discount, the penalty term is balanced by
elements.2211.03240_b75dfaac6cee97d9089c5c272ee12: represents the discrete discount actions, and takes value of 0.75, 0.8, 0.85, 0.9, 0.95 or 1.
elements.2211.03240_360dec9b5b6a0157f1e9152efb34e: shows the distribution over discounts by different policies trained using different algorithms

elements.2211.03240_00ed54801975c3789cbf667db9c8c: On the contrary, our IP policy barely assigns 25

elements.2211.03240_fbde2ebbc009be13733d1dc27130d: To study the effect of Integer Programming(IP), we also combine BCQ and BEAR with IP, where we train BCQ and BEAR as normal, and then instead of directly using their policies during evaluation, we train an IP policy using the Q network trained by the algorithms
elements.2211.03240_5f4ec3e68a9d734f4e0598b0d876a: The results are labeled as BCQ

elements.2211.03240_d00fea7d720b775c9358f7ce714bc: In addition to the overall discount distribution, we also analyze the discounts associated with trip fares

elements.2211.03240_287fcb3dc25e9c75651a174b3ced9: For example, for rides with fare between 70 and 80, our policy turn to assign 20

elements.2211.03240_2d1415d7de6108abd4b123d611423: As we expected, other batch DRL algorithms such as BCQ and BEAR, which learn policy networks to make decisions, are basically impossible to precisely control the budget they use
elements.2211.03240_01c36a20d2b7a327185b50db655f5: In order to make sure they do not exceed the budget, we tune the penalty weight
elements.2211.03240_a1a2226b7cd53ae07d76bd4d67419: so as to discourage the policy from making large discount actions
elements.2211.03240_867c3940d234ad3e3e1003fee1513: Intuitively, the performance would be negatively effected
elements.2211.03240_5c10d9702c475c5dc7c9be8845fb0: From the experiments, we can see that neither weekends nor weekday performance of BCQ or BEAR is better than historical data
elements.2211.03240_494e15e522800bf497049b8199458: To help with the decision-making process and taking better advantages of the value networks, we take the Q networks learned by BCQ and BEAR, but instead of optimizing the policy network by maximizing expected Q values, we use the Integer Programming method mentioned in section
elements.2211.03240_d2f52ea8e94295edee34961e7dc2c: By taking this modification, we witness improvements over weekdays from -0.96
elements.2211.03240_62631ae7e36252a58eb8f1cf8ea51: for BEAR and over weekends from -0.65
elements.2211.03240_374a1ae6ca53fccd87132e67227fd: In addition to quantitative analysis and results, we also discover interesting phenomenons by visualizing our spatio-temporal value net on the city map
elements.2211.03240_cfa831d24d26eb2b76a228cb75170: shows the spatio temporal values of each grid across the city, at two different time slots
elements.2211.03240_ebad19835bcb44f16f4b49f577ebd: shows the spatio-temporal value distribution at peak time from 8:30am to 9:00am
elements.2211.03240_370887f23917d5fe7881f8108f1d0: shows the spatio-temporal values of the same city but at the off-peak hours from 11:30am to 12:00pm
elements.2211.03240_1076c0211edc09a8ca40d162f4bfc: Not surprisingly, during the morning peak time slot, the whole city is more busy and more rides are happening compared to the off-peak time slot
elements.2211.03240_5437cf12fa2d5f1fd39f6fe00a64a: Downtown areas are especially more valuable than other places in the city
elements.2211.03240_6f4aad3a95a85b00d03555650ffa4: To see how our algorithm helps to balance the supply and demand situation of the city
elements.2211.03240_d3788426256f3c1b2e5885b479973: We introduce a new quantitative feature called Dest
elements.2211.03240_c444f5dd43f7bba61b6d7efe745eb: The feature is calculated for each grid of the city at each time slot t
elements.2211.03240_a5b94925ac171c3d16127693a64c8: is the set of all the rides arriving at destination grid
elements.2211.03240_3d48e0bf47332be8ba1997c307069: We also calculate supply minus demand information of each hexagon grid of the city map at each time slot t
elements.2211.03240_11ade7b8bd4e250a322c096015e3a: If supply minus demand is smaller than zero, we can say that at this time slot t, the grid is in short supply and needs more drivers
elements.2211.03240_d5d7961f88118b3d9e4818ef17eaa: , the grid which we are focused on is a residential area
elements.2211.03240_1fb7661dda91f8580f1a63b6508b3: During the morning peak time slot on a weekday, lots of people are leaving the area for work, thus, the grid has a negative value of supply minus demand, which means it's in short supply
elements.2211.03240_357e02985ca91b389c44bf8d5ce5e: Hence, we want to encourage rides to the area at that time slot, which will also bring drivers to the area to compensate for the short supply
elements.2211.03240_0a63ba8589c4e5741cf52dbcd14b2: Under this situation, historical data, as shown in figure
elements.2211.03240_5ddedffada1decbbfce3bc355186a: equals 0.246, while our policy in Figure
elements.2211.03240_e69b7915511cc5945fd9c9cf0b9de: equals 0.383 at the same grid and same time slot
elements.2211.03240_094bde4313269894efea1202891c8: This means, discount distribution by our policy, compared to historical distribution, assigns more discounts on trips going to that residential grid
elements.2211.03240_9a807102ac5ee77f1616131f2c59e: In other words, we increase the passengers' ecr of the rides going to the grid at that time slot in order to help with the supply and demand imbalance of the city
elements.2211.03240_5eff6a9eae34c95d7bb93c69fa52a: To better analyze and has a broader view of the effectiveness of our policy on the imbalanced supply and demand problem, we sum over all
elements.2211.03240_2c85ffa1a5c4dd9d19df69964b3b6: only on destination grids that are in short supply
elements.2211.03240_60df752e245b5d70ab0127c1e7067: We want the grids in short supply to have more drivers coming to meet the demands, which means we expect the sum over all
elements.2211.03240_c42bd19f1b47f289bb12d3f60c65c: for grids in short supply to be as large as possible but meanwhile do not exceed the budget
elements.2211.03240_2f9bc4ea0235d15975ea5526a6b66: For weekdays, our policy has increased the sum of destination delta ecr values by 106.67
elements.2211.03240_5f8e2c40a680f6c2a0919925b35ad: , and has increased the sum of destination delta ecr values by 152
elements.2211.03240_3dd4be38c423f0f8c0c3b44096606: BCQ and BEAR have also increased about 40
elements.2211.03240_ff5065a184220501919971e626527: for weekends, but BCQ only does a slightly better job for weekdays
elements.2211.03240_73b0b8ad8b3aa04945ec140ab2f85: However, when combining with IP, BCQ
elements.2211.03240_845b488fcabbe27200a65d76a87c6: IP also does a much better job than vanilla BEAR
elements.2211.03240_41af08e9249f3662c9de7a4cb1585: The result indicates the importance of IP and the advantage over a normal policy network in our application of discount distribution.
elements.2211.03240_471f6085d0b25c10a396487b752cd: This paper has proposed an offline deep reinforcement learning method to learn the spatial-temporal long-term value in the whole city, as a guidance to dynamically adjust the spatial-temporal distribution of demand, to improve the efficiency of the marketplace
elements.2211.03240_1e72cb6a1c5d8f1e8c45871830dce: The goal is to optimize the ride-hailing platform's long-term efficiency, as well as balancing customer demands and driver supply in the city
elements.2211.03240_d2469548bca686fe9a99ca3b948a1: To do so, we model the pricing problem as a sequential decision-making problem
elements.2211.03240_56a2f31166ee8f1c8aad6dfab2cfe: Experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm and the importance of the integer programming step
elements.2211.03240_74d2c031a8feb56a58a97f907ff8a: We deliver an improvements in both total revenue and efficiency in balancing supply and demand across the city.
